it.flaten.mjolnir

Class Mjolnir

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bukkit.plugin.PluginBase
      • org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin
        • it.flaten.mjolnir.Mjolnir
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor, org.bukkit.command.TabCompleter, org.bukkit.command.TabExecutor, org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin

    public class Mjolnir
extends org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin
    The plugin's main class. We extend Bukkit's JavaPlugin class, and implement our own entry and exit points to handle plugin initialization.
    Author:
    Jim Flaten

    • Field Detail

      • storage

        private Storage storage
        Where we'll keep our Storage implementation. The variable is accessed by various methods that need to communicate directly with the storage.

      • databaseClasses

        public static final List<Class<?>> databaseClasses
        A list of our beans. This can be used by Storage implementations to see which beans it should expect.

    • Method Detail

      • onEnable

        public void onEnable()
        Plugin entry point. This method is automatically invoked by the Bukkit server implementation when the plugin is enabled. It handles plugin configuration, storage initialization, Bukkit event bindings, and command bindings.
        Specified by:
        onEnable in interface org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin
        Overrides:
        onEnable in class org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin

      • onDisable

        public void onDisable()
        Plugin exit point. This method is invoked by the Bukkit implementation before the plugin is disabled. Usually before the server shuts down. It releases command and event binds, and shuts down the storage.
        Specified by:
        onDisable in interface org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin
        Overrides:
        onDisable in class org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin

      • getDatabaseClasses

        public List<Class<?>> getDatabaseClasses()
        Get the beans used for storage. This information can be used by Storage implementations to prepare for the types of data they will receive.
        Overrides:
        getDatabaseClasses in class org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin
        Returns:
        A list of Classes.

      • installDDL

        public void installDDL()
        Create tables required for data storage. This method does nothing more than expose the protected JavaPlugin.installDDL() in the JavaPlugin class so that classes implementing Storage can use it if needed.
        Overrides:
        installDDL in class org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin

      • getEventHistory

        public List<Event> getEventHistory(String player)
        Get all events for a player. Fetchs all the events stored for the given player.
        Parameters:
        player - The name of the player whose Events to fetch.
        Returns:
        A List of Events, oldest first.

      • getActiveEvent

        Event getActiveEvent(String player)
        Get the active Event for a player. Fetches the latest stored Event for the given player that has not expired. Will return null of no Event is found.
        Parameters:
        player - The name of the player whose Event to fetch.
        Returns:
        The active Event, or null.

      • getExternalEvent

        Event getExternalEvent(String player)
        Get an Event for an external plugin. Fires an IsBannedEvent and returns the Event returned from it, or null if there is no Event.
        Parameters:
        player - The name of the player whose Event to fetch.
        Returns:
        An Event created by an external plugin, or null.

      • buildKickMessage

        public String buildKickMessage(Event event)
        Build kick message. This method composes the message displayed to players who are kicked, from an Event bean.
        Parameters:
        event - The Event that caused this kick.
        Returns:
        The message the kicked player will see.

      • buildBroadcastMessage

        public String buildBroadcastMessage(Event event)
        Build broadcast message. This method composes the message displayed to in-game players when a player is kicked, from an Event bean.
        Parameters:
        event - The Event that caused this kick.
        Returns:
        The message in-game players will see.

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(Event event)
        Broadcast a message. This will build a broadcast message with buildBroadcastMessage(it.flaten.mjolnir.beans.Event) from an Event, and send it to in-game players with the correct permissions.
        Parameters:
        event - The Event used to generate the message.

      • banPlayer

        public Event banPlayer(String player,
              String op)
        Permanently ban a player. Used to permanently ban a player, with no reason.
        Parameters:
        player - The name of the player to kick and ban.
        op - The name of the player who executes the ban.
        Returns:
        The resulting ban Event.

      • unbanPlayer

        public Event unbanPlayer(String player,
                String op)
        Permanently unban a player. Used to permanently unban a banned player, with no reason.
        Parameters:
        player - The name of the player to unban.
        op - The name of the player who executes the unban.
        Returns:
        The resulting unban Event.

      • banPlayer

              String op,
              String reason)

        Parameters:
        player - The name of the player to kick and ban.
        op - The name of the player who executes the ban.
        reason - The reason for this ban.
        Returns:
        The resulting ban Event.

        reason - The reason for this unban.
        Returns:

                  String op,

        Parameters:
        player - The name of the player to ban.
        op - The name of the player who executes the ban.
        expires - Length of ban in parseTime(String) format.
        Returns:
        The resulting ban Event.

                    String op,

        Parameters:
        player - The name of the player to be unbanned.
        op - The name of the player who executes the unban.
        expires - Length of ban in parseTime(String) format.
        Returns:
        The resulting unban Event.

        Parameters:
        player - The name of the player to unban.
        op - The name of the player who executes the unban.
        reason - The reason for this unban.
        expires - Length of unban in parseTime(String) format.
        Returns:

      • parseTime

        public static int parseTime(String time)
        Parse a time period string. Parses a string looking for the following time notations: 1y, where 1 can be any number of years. 1w, where 1 can be any number of weeks. 1d, where 1 can be any number of days. 1h, where 1 can be any number of hours. 1m, where 1 can be any number of minutes. 1s, where 1 can be any number of seconds. It then returns the current UNIX time plus the specified amount of time.

        If the given time string sums to 0, then 0 is returned.

        Parameters:
        time - A length of time in the supported format.
        Returns:
        A UNIX timestamp somewhere in the future, or 0.

      • preProcess

        public NewEventEvent preProcess(Event event)
        Pre-process an event. Invoked before the given Event is saved in storage. Fires off a NewEventEvent to let other plugins know a new Event is about to be created, and lets them cancel it.
        Parameters:
        event - The Event to process.

      • postProcess

        public void postProcess(Event event)
        Post-process an event. Invoked after the given Event has been saved in storage. Kicks online players when they are banned.
        Parameters:
        event - The Event to process.

      • isBanned

        public boolean isBanned(String player)
        Check if a player is banned. Checks if a player is banned in Mjlnir, and if not also queries external plugins using the IsBannedEvent event via isBannedExternally(String).
        Parameters:
        player - The name of the player to check.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the given player is banned.

      • isBannedLocally

        public boolean isBannedLocally(String player)
        Check if a player is banned locally. Fetches the given player's active Event from our database, and checks its type.

        If the player is banned, why(String) can be invoked to get the Event dictating so.

        Parameters:
        player - The name of the player to check.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the given player is banned locally.

      • isBannedExternally

        public boolean isBannedExternally(String player)
        Check if a player is banned externally. Fires a IsBannedEvent to query external plugins for Events, then checks the Event.EventType.

        If the player is banned, why(String) can be invoked to get the Event dictating so.

        Parameters:
        player - The name of the player to check.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the given player is banned externally.

      • why

        public void why(String player,
       Event event)
        Set which Event dictated the given player's fate. Used to let others know why isBanned(String) returned what it did. Memory is freed if the Event is null.
        Parameters:
        player - The name of the player this Event belongs to
        event - The Event.

      • why

        public Event why(String player)
        Get the Event that dictated the given player's fate.
        Parameters:
        player - The name of the player whose Event to fetch.
        Returns:
        The Event.
